metadata.title: CVE-2022-48619 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/input/input.c in the Linux kernel before5.17.10. An attacker can cause a denial of service (panic) becauseinput_set_capability mishandles the situation in which an event code fallsoutside of a bitmap.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142
linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-126.142
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-lowlatency - 5.4.0-126.142
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-48-generic - 5.15.0-48.54~20.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-126.142').
